title: Netanyahu speaks to US President Biden as Israel mulls action against Iran
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris as Israel prepares to retaliate against Iran's missile attack. Defence Minister Yoav Gallant promised a lethal, precise, and surprising response, while Netanyahu reached out to Iranians, criticizing their government.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris as Israel prepares to retaliate against Iran's missile attack. Defence Minister Yoav Gallant promised a lethal, precise, and surprising response, while Netanyahu reached out to Iranians, criticizing their government.

title: Diddy to seek trial date in April, May 2025; will move against leaks of jury information: Latest updates
content: Diddy's lawyers plan to seek a trial date for April or May 2025, while also addressing unauthorized grand jury leaks. The government is coordinating discovery, which includes several terabytes of electronic materials. Diddy asserts his right to a speedy trial and demands timely production of his seized devices. The government said the discovery in the case has been voluminous, totaling several terabytes of electronic materials including cellphones, laptops, tablets and cloud accounts.
summary: Diddy's lawyers plan to seek a trial date for April or May 2025, while also addressing unauthorized grand jury leaks. The government is coordinating discovery, which includes several terabytes of electronic materials. Diddy asserts his right to a speedy trial and demands timely production of his seized devices. The government said the discovery in the case has been voluminous, totaling several terabytes of electronic materials including cellphones, laptops, tablets and cloud accounts.

title: Influencer slammed for refusing to evacuate for Hurricane Milton: 'I have champagne'
content: Caroline explained that she would not be evacuating as she can't drive and then the airport is closed. “Third of all, the last time I evacuated for a hurricane, I went to my mom’s house in Northport for Hurricane Ian … Her whole street flooded and we were evacuated after three days without power or running water by the US military,” she said.
summary: Caroline explained that she would not be evacuating as she can't drive and then the airport is closed. “Third of all, the last time I evacuated for a hurricane, I went to my mom’s house in Northport for Hurricane Ian … Her whole street flooded and we were evacuated after three days without power or running water by the US military,” she said.

title: Melania makes this gesture when asked about Trump's nightdress: Watch
content: ​Former First Lady Melania Trump appeared on Fox News to promote her memoir 'Melania' and was asked intimate details about Donald Trump. The speculations that not everything is alright between Melania and Donald have been put to rest for the time being as Melania wrote a great deal about Donald Trump in her book and the former president is also praises about Melania and her memoir.
summary: ​Former First Lady Melania Trump appeared on Fox News to promote her memoir 'Melania' and was asked intimate details about Donald Trump. The speculations that not everything is alright between Melania and Donald have been put to rest for the time being as Melania wrote a great deal about Donald Trump in her book and the former president is also praises about Melania and her memoir.

title: Barron Trump was denied a bank account due to 'cancel mob', reveals Melania in memoir
content: Melania Trump revealed that Barron Trump was denied a new bank account following the Capitol Riots in 2021. “This decision appeared to be rooted in political discrimination, raising serious concerns about civil rights violations," Melania wrote without naming the bank. “The ‘cancel mob’ now includes corporations, traditional media, influential social media figures, and cultural institutions,” Melania wrote. “This disheartening trend reflects the current socio-political landscape in the United States.”
summary: Melania Trump revealed that Barron Trump was denied a new bank account following the Capitol Riots in 2021. “This decision appeared to be rooted in political discrimination, raising serious concerns about civil rights violations," Melania wrote without naming the bank.  “The ‘cancel mob’ now includes corporations, traditional media, influential social media figures, and cultural institutions,” Melania wrote. “This disheartening trend reflects the current socio-political landscape in the United States.”

title: Watch: Donald Trump can't praise Elon Musk's waistline enough; 'Does he work out?'
content: ​Elon is a piece of work, Donald Trump said when at the interview he was asked whether Elon Musk was his favorite African-American. "Elon is a great guy. He is obviously a brilliant guy...He's got a great heart...I have a lot of people who are big supporters of me but they won't go all out. There's a cost and liability also. But this guy was jumping on the stage saying you gotta vote for Trump," the former president said.
summary: ​Elon is a piece of work, Donald Trump said when at the interview he was asked whether Elon Musk was his favorite African-American. "Elon is a great guy. He is obviously a brilliant guy...He's got a great heart...I have a lot of people who are big supporters of me but they won't go all out. There's a cost and liability also. But this guy was jumping on the stage saying you gotta vote for Trump," the former president said.

title: Ro Khanna says Elon Musk supported Obama but Democrats lost him
content: Democratic leader Ro Khanna indirectly blamed the Biden-Harris administration for losing the support of Elon Musk while Barack Obama, Bill Clinton had Elon's support. Ro said Elon Musk was not celebrated enough by the Democrats and that offended him. "I certainly think he should not be making jokes about the Vice President. But I think with the Democrats, remember, he was a supporter of Obama, Bill Clinton. And we are the party that is John F Kennedy. That is about innovation. That is about entrepreneurship," Ro said at a CNN panel.
summary: Democratic leader Ro Khanna indirectly blamed the Biden-Harris administration for losing the support of Elon Musk while Barack Obama, Bill Clinton had Elon's support. Ro said Elon Musk was not celebrated enough by the Democrats and that offended him. "I certainly think he should not be making jokes about the Vice President. But I think with the Democrats, remember, he was a supporter of Obama, Bill Clinton. And we are the party that is John F Kennedy. That is about innovation. That is about entrepreneurship," Ro said at a CNN panel.

title: Kamala Harris' husband Doug Emhoff was misogynistic at work, claims report
content: Daily Mail reports allegations of inappropriate behavior by Doug Emhoff at his former law firm, including misogynistic practices and favoritism. Former colleagues claim he revoked perks from women who didn't flirt with him and hired unqualified staff based on attractiveness. The allegations surfaced after Daily Mail reported that he once slapped his girlfriend -- an allegation that Doug Emhoff rejected.
summary: Daily Mail reports allegations of inappropriate behavior by Doug Emhoff at his former law firm, including misogynistic practices and favoritism. Former colleagues claim he revoked perks from women who didn't flirt with him and hired unqualified staff based on attractiveness. The allegations surfaced after Daily Mail reported that he once slapped his girlfriend -- an allegation that Doug Emhoff rejected.

title: 'Real reason Kamala Harris chose Miller High Life beer on The Late Show is...'
content: ​"Imagine losing Wisconsin because you drank High Life out of a can instead of a bottle because some intern on Colbert’s team knows almost nothing about beer and bought the first Miller product they saw on the shelf," an X post read after social media went berserk over Kamala Harris' choice of beer at The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. Miller High Life beer that Kamala asked for is brewed in Wisconsin, one of the swing states and is popular among the working class.
summary: ​"Imagine losing Wisconsin because you drank High Life out of a can instead of a bottle because some intern on Colbert’s team knows almost nothing about beer and bought the first Miller product they saw on the shelf," an X post read after social media went berserk over Kamala Harris' choice of beer at The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. Miller High Life beer that Kamala asked for is brewed in Wisconsin, one of the swing states and is popular among the working class.

title: Turkish Airlines pilot dies mid-flight prompting emergency landing in New York
content: A Turkish Airlines pilot collapsed and died mid-flight on an Airbus 350 from Seattle to Istanbul, prompting an emergency landing in New York. Despite first aid efforts by the crew, the 59-year-old pilot, who had no prior health issues as per a recent medical exam, passed away before the plane landed.
summary: A Turkish Airlines pilot collapsed and died mid-flight on an Airbus 350 from Seattle to Istanbul, prompting an emergency landing in New York. Despite first aid efforts by the crew, the 59-year-old pilot, who had no prior health issues as per a recent medical exam, passed away before the plane landed.

title: Piers Morgan issues apology to Jay-Z, Beyoncé after Jaguar Wright's drags their name in 'Diddy' drama
Nobel prize in Chemistry awarded to David Baker, Demis Hassabis and John M. Jumper
content: David Baker wins half of the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for computational protein design, while Demis Hassabis and John M. Jumper share the other half for protein structure prediction. The Nobel Prize announcements kicked off with Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun winning the medicine prize. Last year, the chemistry prize was awarded to a trio of scientists.
summary: David Baker wins half of the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for computational protein design, while Demis Hassabis and John M. Jumper share the other half for protein structure prediction. The Nobel Prize announcements kicked off with Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun winning the medicine prize. Last year, the chemistry prize was awarded to a trio of scientists.

title: Turkey moves to evacuate nationals from Lebanon
content: Turkey initiated the evacuation of approximately 2,000 of its citizens from Lebanon amid escalating conflict. Two naval ships departed overnight and are expected in Mersin, Turkey. Approximately 300 tonnes of humanitarian aid are also being delivered to support the Lebanese people.
summary: Turkey initiated the evacuation of approximately 2,000 of its citizens from Lebanon amid escalating conflict. Two naval ships departed overnight and are expected in Mersin, Turkey. Approximately 300 tonnes of humanitarian aid are also being delivered to support the Lebanese people.

title: Turkey blocks access to Discord messaging platform
content: Turkey blocked access to the Discord social media platform Wednesday to "protect" children and young people from online abuse, the justice minister said. "We are determined to protect our young people and our children... from harmful and criminal publications on social media and the internet," Turkish Justice Minister Yilmaz Tunc wrote on X, formerly Twitter.
summary: Turkey blocked access to the Discord social media platform Wednesday to "protect" children and young people from online abuse, the justice minister said.  "We are determined to protect our young people and our children... from harmful and criminal publications on social media and the internet," Turkish Justice Minister Yilmaz Tunc wrote on X, formerly Twitter.

title: 'If Israel were to stop ...': What Canadian LOP Pierre Poilievre said on Israel restricting Iran's nuclear power
content: Canadian opposition leader Pierre Poilievre strongly endorses potential Israeli military action against Iran’s nuclear program, calling it a "gift to humanity." He emphasizes the global security threat posed by Iran developing nuclear weapons. Poilievre's stance contrasts with US President Biden’s opposition to such interventions. He also faced penalties in the House of Commons for comments about foreign minister Mélanie Joly.
summary: Canadian opposition leader Pierre Poilievre strongly endorses potential Israeli military action against Iran’s nuclear program, calling it a "gift to humanity." He emphasizes the global security threat posed by Iran developing nuclear weapons. Poilievre's stance contrasts with US President Biden’s opposition to such interventions. He also faced penalties in the House of Commons for comments about foreign minister Mélanie Joly.

title: Balochistan witnessed 41 incidents of enforced disappearances in July: Report
content: PAANK's September report reveals alarming human rights abuses in Balochistan, including 41 enforced disappearances, three extrajudicial killings, and 25 cases of torture. The government's Fourth Schedule policy further restricts and surveils thousands of political activists, while peaceful protests face violent suppression.
summary: PAANK's September report reveals alarming human rights abuses in Balochistan, including 41 enforced disappearances, three extrajudicial killings, and 25 cases of torture. The government's Fourth Schedule policy further restricts and surveils thousands of political activists, while peaceful protests face violent suppression.

title: Pak's JUI-F dismisses rumours of supporting proposed constitutional amendment
content: The JUI-F denies agreeing to support the PML-N-led coalition's proposed constitutional amendment. The amendment's introduction, initially postponed at JUI-F's request, remains controversial. Discussions continue, with demands for draft exchanges and a suggestion for a separate constitutional bench instead of an independent court.
summary: The JUI-F denies agreeing to support the PML-N-led coalition's proposed constitutional amendment. The amendment's introduction, initially postponed at JUI-F's request, remains controversial. Discussions continue, with demands for draft exchanges and a suggestion for a separate constitutional bench instead of an independent court.

title: Kremlin: Trump sent Putin Covid tests while President
content: Former US President Trump secretly sent Covid-19 testing devices to Russian President Putin during the pandemic, while devices were scarce. The Kremlin confirmed the shipment but denied phone conversations post-Trump presidency. This revelation has sparked criticism from US VP Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden, who accuse Trump of compromising national security by being too close to dictators.
summary: Former US President Trump secretly sent Covid-19 testing devices to Russian President Putin during the pandemic, while devices were scarce. The Kremlin confirmed the shipment but denied phone conversations post-Trump presidency. This revelation has sparked criticism from US VP Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden, who accuse Trump of compromising national security by being too close to dictators.

title: Pakistan, Afghan fight it out at border amid fencing work
content: Pakistani border troops clashed with Afghan Taliban fighters after an attack on a border post, resulting in significant Taliban casualties. The incident, part of ongoing tensions, happened during fence repair work along the Naushki-Ghazni sector. Recent unprovoked aggression from the Afghan side has strained the hopes of improved relations following the Taliban’s rise to power in 2021.
summary: Pakistani border troops clashed with Afghan Taliban fighters after an attack on a border post, resulting in significant Taliban casualties. The incident, part of ongoing tensions, happened during fence repair work along the Naushki-Ghazni sector. Recent unprovoked aggression from the Afghan side has strained the hopes of improved relations following the Taliban’s rise to power in 2021.

title: What are 'Ghost guns' which US Supreme Court seeks to regulate?
content: The US Supreme Court demonstrated strong support for federal regulation of ghost guns, endorsing measures to curb untraceable firearm kits. Five justices backed the Biden administration’s regulation mandating serial numbers and background checks. The rule aims to address increasing ghost gun-related violence, with over 70,700 instances reported by the ATF between 2016 and 2022.
summary: The US Supreme Court demonstrated strong support for federal regulation of ghost guns, endorsing measures to curb untraceable firearm kits. Five justices backed the Biden administration’s regulation mandating serial numbers and background checks. The rule aims to address increasing ghost gun-related violence, with over 70,700 instances reported by the ATF between 2016 and 2022.
